y are an intern striving to be hired. They will have to talk to the right people and run errands for those higher up the corporate ladder which, since they are
an intern, turns out to be everyone!
What sets Intern's Quest apart from other games on the market today is the nostalgic feel
of the adventure RPG’s of yester-year with a healthy dash of humour sprinkled throughout.
ltimate victory condition will be getting hired which can be accomplished by completing all of the required
Timed quests will motivate the player to get things done in a timely fashion and
Humour and inspiring dialog will keep the player coming back to see what happens next
The quests will often lead the player to another area of the office where there are more people to talk to and things to do.
The game’s appeal and selling position will come from the simple game play elements
that anyone can easily pick up
Intern’s Quest will be an adventure role playing game played viewed from a ¾ top perspective.
Game play will subsist of the player controlling an intern
starts with the player observing a scene in which
character is standing in the middle of an office like room. A non player character tentatively called “The Boss” walks over to the character and
for use throughout the rest of the game.
This will also be where a crash course introduction to the game controls and game interface.
The purpose of the game is to complete all the tasks

Following the player’s initial confrontation with “The Boss” the player will be free to explore the office environment. There will be other non player characters dispersed throughout the office. Some will be friendly to the player offering helpful & humorous advice, others will
treat the player with indifference and still others will appear very mean.
Some of the non player characters will ask the intern to complete one or more tasks (quests) for them.
These quests will be in addition to the main quest chain.
Should the player fail to complete a
“The Boss” will be notified. If too many quests are failed then the player is “fired” thus ending the game.
and females who are at least 13 years of age. Although the game will not feature
. Some of the jokes may go over the heads of younger players as they have never worked in an office environment.

) and high end PC’s. Estimated requirements:
